intro: Randia latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Randia latifolia is often found in moist, shady environments such as forests and stream banks. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed berry that contains several seeds.
